River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowed and complex plot makes the film frustrating to watch. I found myself confused and frustrated and wishing there were subtitles so I could understand the French characters. It reminded me of Bracewell’s Heroes lyrics, which I reckon is no bad thing. Overcomplicated, and underappreciated.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area swarming with feeding snakes. They are missing an arm and a leg each, but appear to be alive. Then they start attacking the crew who summoned them.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy feral humans became so elite that they are completely different beings that rule the emerald, or gem studded, brilliant sun.
